definition: spry and lively (of dancing and movements)
to manner of dancing/to walk around

sentences.english: The eight immortals yangko, dragon-lion dance to the operating vitality.
sentences.chinese: 秧歌龙狮舞翩跹，营运活力赛八仙。

sentences.english: My mind's eye, peeping through the window, backs off, fluttering under the awning.
sentences.chinese: 我的灵目透过窗缝偷窥，退后，翩跹于遮阳棚下。

sentences.english: When life such as butterflies, occasionally stop recreation, do not forget lightly.
sentences.chinese: 人生当如彩蝶，间或停憩，勿忘翩跹。

sentences.english: Happiness is the prairie in spring, seeing a spring idea full of life, the butterfly dances.
sentences.chinese: 幸福是在春天的原野，看春意盎然，蝶舞翩跹。

sentences.english: The waves were beside the daffodils and the mountains around them.
sentences.chinese: 水波潋滟，山峦重嶂，但又怎比这水仙的舞步翩跹。

sentences.english: Love Fantasy, dance out the eyes of fine lines, but also one year.
sentences.chinese: 年华翩跹，舞出了眼角的细纹，又是一年。

sentences.english: Dressed in white, Su-wrapped exquisite, lightly dance steps, but also graceful as ever.
sentences.chinese: 一袭白纱，素裹玲珑，翩跹舞步，却也盈盈如昔。

definition: (literary) (of a woman) to have a graceful demeanor/beautiful woman
Nichang, abbr. for the Tang Dynasty song "Raiment of Rainbows and Feathers" 霓裳羽衣曲[Ni2 chang2 yu3 yi1 qu1] or 霓裳羽衣舞[Ni2 chang2 yu3 yi1 wu3]
nichang, rainbow colored clothes worn by the Eight Immortals 八仙[Ba1 xian1]
to sway gently (as in the wind)/(of a flame) to flicker
